lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Nguyen_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Nguyen.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Nguyen.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents a task that has a deadline.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an event task that has a start time and an end time.
* Constructs a new Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + from.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy")) + " to: " + to.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy")) + ")";
* The main class for the chatbot "Nguyen".
* This chatbot allows users to manage tasks, including adding, deleting, marking, and listing them.
* Represents different types of tasks a user can create.
* The main method that runs the chatbot.
* It continuously takes user input and processes different commands.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* Custom exception class for handling errors in the Nguyen chatbot.
* Constructs a new NguyenException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message associated with the exception.

* Represents a task with a description and a completion status.

* By default, the task is not done.

* Returns the status icon for the task.
* "X" represents a completed task, and " " represents an incomplete task.
* @return The status icon ("X" for done, " " for not done).
* Unmarks the task (marks as not completed).
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
